document.docAuthor: Liao, Hauchuan, Terayama, Mamoru & Eguchi, Katsuyuki
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Taiwanese and Ryukyuan species of Propristocera (Hymenoptera: Bethylidae), with description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Taiwanese and Ryukyuan species of Propristocera (Hymenoptera: Bethylidae), with description of a new species

paragraph.subSubSection:
Apenesia pingtungensis
Terayama, 1996: 25
, Figs 17 –19, type: holotype (male, NSMT, examined), type loc.: Kentin Park,
Pingtung Hisen, Taiwan .
Propristocera pingtungensis :
Azevedo et al ., 2018: 115
(genus transfer).
Apenesia kusigematii Terayama, 1999: 704
, Figs 17 –22, type: holotype (male, NIAES, examined), type loc.: Kanpira, Iriomote-

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Male . TL = 7 mm . HL/HW × 100 = 109–118. Dorsal face of head with dense and deep foveae (ca. 0.04– 0.05 mm in diameter) with intervals smooth and shining; intervals in vertex usually as wide as or narrower than diameter of foveae; intervals in frons usually narrower than diameter of foveae. Clypeus obtuse-triangular. Mandible with one apical tooth. LP/WP = 0.98–1.10. Metapostnotal median carina complete. Apical lobe of aedeagus forming one large apicolateral extension largely hooked ventrobasad, not reaching level of ventral valve of aedeagus; outer edge of extension serrate.
Male description. Full description was given by Terayama (1996 , 1999 ). Additional information as below.

Head. HL/HW × 100 = 109–118 ( holotype 109). Dorsal face with dense and deep foveae (ca. 0.04–0.05 mm in diameter) with intervals smooth and shining; intervals in vertex usually as wide as or narrower than diameter of foveae; intervals in median part of frons usually narrower than diameter of foveae. Occipital carina present.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 15.
Propristocera pingtungensis
, holotype. A, head in dorsal view; B, antenna (left); C, mandible; D, mesosoma in lateral view; E, forewing; F, mesosoma in dorsal view. Scale = 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Mesosoma. Mesopleuron elongate, largely smooth and shining excluding anterior, upper and lower depressions; anterior, upper and lower depressions present, with inconspicuous foveae; mesopleural pit absent. Lateral surface of metapectal-propodeal complex obliquely rugose in marginal area, and irregularly rugose in central area. Metapectal-propodeal complex in dorsal view with LP/WP = 0.98–1.10 ( holotype 1.10), with lateral margins subparallel and slightly convex; metapostnotal median carina very distinct, almost reaching posterior margin (or reaching posterior margin in holotype of “
P. kusigematii
”); submedian rugae very distinct, irregularly running; sublateral margin mod- erately distinct; posterior margin moderately distinct, almost straight; dorsomedian face strongly rugoso-scabrous, with intervals smooth and shining; antero-inner portion of dorsolateral face imbricate; postero-outer portion of dor- solateral face strongly areolate-rugose, with intervals imbricate; median portion of propodeal declivity transversely rugoso-scabrous weakly to strongly. Forewing with cu-a not meeting directly with Rs+m (arrows in Fig. 15E ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 16.
Propristocera kusigematii
, holotype. A, head in dorsal view; B, mandible; C, mesosoma in lateral view; D, mesosoma in dorsal view; E, forewing. Scale = 0.5 mm

subSubSection.paragraph: Metasoma. Hypopygium with median stalk a little shorter than lateral ones; apical part relatively strongly incurved and trilobate, with two large lateral and one small median lobes; outer face of apicomedian part with long setae. Basiparamere glabrous. Paramere in ventral view elongate-triangular, slightly curved inward, with blunt apex, entirely covered with setae increasing apicad; inner basal portion with concavity which accommodates digitus and cuspis. Cuspis lobate and extending outward; middle and subapical parts of outer face with short and thin setae. Digitus extending outward, curled; outer face with foveae. Apical lobe of aedeagus forming one large apicolateral extension largely hooked ventrobasad, not reaching level of ventral valve of aedeagus; outer edge of extension ser- rate; medium valve of aedeagus absent.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 17.
Propristocera pingtungensis
, specimen TP170606_10. A, head in dorsal view; B, right antenna; C, mandible; D, mesosoma in lateral view; E, mesosoma in dorsal view; F, forewing; G, hind wing. Scale = 0.5 mm

FIGURE 18.
Propristocera pingtungensis
, specimen TN160725_07-3. A, hypopygium; B, C, genitalia in ventral view; D, left apical lobe in outer view. Scale = 0.2mm

13/ VIII/2017
.

Taxonomic remarks. This species is most similar in general appearance to
P. seediq
among the named species known from East and Southeast Asia. However, both morphological and molecular evidences strongly support the heterospecificity of
P. pingtungensis
and
P. seediq
(see the taxonomic remarks of
P. seediq
).

This species is also very similar to
P. formosimonticola
in structure of hypopygium and genitalia, but easily distinguished from the latter as mentioned in the Taxonomic remarks of
P. formosimonticola
.

Our reexamination of the holotypes of
P. pingtungensis
and
P. kusigematii
strongly suggested the conspecificity of the two species. Furthermore, the “
P. pingtungensis
” specimens collected from the type locality ( Pingtung , southern Taiwan ) and the “
P. kusigematii
” specimens from Ishigaki-jima (near the type locality of
P. kusigematii
) were nested in a strongly supported clade ( Fig. 6 ). Therefore,
P. kusigematii
is herein synonymized with
P. pingtungensis
.

Distribution and habitat. Central and Southern Ryukyus in Japan ( Terayama 1996 , Terayama 1999 ); northern, midland and southern Taiwan . This species has been collected from evergreen broadleaved forests.
